title: Suspense vs. Surprise: Hitchcock's Lesson
description: A quick win: understand Suspense vs. Surprise: Hitchcock's Lesson.

hook.text: A bomb explodes under a table ‚Äî surprise. You know the bomb is there but the characters don't ‚Äî suspense.

buildup.text: Hitchcock explained: surprise gives you 15 seconds of shock. Suspense gives you 15 minutes of tension.

discovery.text: Suspense works because it creates information asymmetry ‚Äî the audience knows something the character doesn't.

twist.text: This is why spoilers don't always ruin stories. Studies show knowing the twist can actually increase enjoyment.

climax.text: Hitchcock's principle: give the audience information. The anticipation of what will happen is more powerful than the.

punchline.text: Don't hide the bomb. Show it ticking.
